Q. What happens if the budget is defeated?

A. Due to the time constraints and restrictions caused by COVID-19, districts in NYS may not have the time or funds to conduct a second vote this year. As a result, they may have to go directly to a contingency budget. A contingency budget only funds salaries and other ordinary contingent expenses that are legally obligated or necessary to maintain education, safety and property. Contingency budgets generally do not allow for the purchase of equipment, nonessential maintenance, capital expenditures or any public use of school property that would have associated costs.

Q. Why did the Board of Education adopt a budget that resulted in a tax levy increase, when the district has reserves available?

A. While it is true that the Attica CSD has established reserve funds, these reserves have laws and regulations on how and when they can be used. For example, the Capital Reserve can only be used for “capital project work” and must be approved by the voters. Other reserves have similar limitations based on their established purpose. The Board of Education has agreed to bring forth the use of reserves totaling $676,252 for the 2020-21 school year.

Starting tomorrow, Wednesday, the main entrances at the high school and middle school will be locked until 7:30am. Students will not be allowed in the HS or MS buildings prior to 7:30am. Students will need to enter the building through the middle bus loop entrance, Entrance #31 or at the end of the East Hall at Entrance #30.

If you have any questions concerning these changes please contact Mr. Audsley, HS Principal, or Mr. Clark, Middle School Principal. Thank you.

This just in! WSI – Water Safety Instructor class scheduled. Three Saturdays in March...March 10, 17, & 24 from 9 am - 3 pm.

This class prepares participants to teach Red Cross Swim Lessons. Topics covered will include parent and child aquatics, preschool aquatics, learn-to-swim levels 1-6, safety in the aquatic environment, customizing for special needs, adult swim lessons, hydrodynamic principles, aquatic disciplines and more. This is an instructor led class. Participants will need to swim 1 lap of front crawl, back crawl, breaststroke, elementary back and side stroke as well as 15 yards of butterfly to level 4 performance standards. This class takes about 35 to 40 hours. Participants will be required to prepare practice teaching assignments and take a written test. Need minimum of 4 to run class. Dealing with your family's photo collection--whether it's unnamed relatives in an old album, boxes stacked in the basement or thousands loaded on a laptop--is one of the most challenging decluttering activities.
